# SKTextureAtlas

**Class**

A collection of textures optimized for storage and drawing performance.

## Declaration

```swift
class SKTextureAtlas
```

## Overview

An `SKTextureAtlas` is a collection of textures that were either created from an `.atlas` folder in the app bundle, or created at runtime. Texture atlases improve memory usage and rendering performance by reducing draw calls. Whenever you have textures that are always used together, store them in an atlas for best results.

SpriteKit implicitly loads an atlas when one of the atlas’s textures is accessed. Use [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKTextureAtlas/textureNamed(_:)] when you want to explicitly access a texture atlas’s contents.

The preferred place to create a texture atlas is within an asset catalog (see [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/about-texture-atlases#Creating-a-Sprite-Atlas]), but you can also put your source textures in an `.atlas` folder in the app bundle.

## First Steps

- **About Texture Atlases**: Learn about the benefits of having a texture atlas, and the process for using it.

## Accessing Textures

- **textureNamed(_:)**: Creates a texture from data stored in the texture atlas.

## Creating a Texture Atlas Programmatically

- **init(named:)**: Creates a texture atlas from data stored in the app bundle.
- **init(dictionary:)**: Creates a texture atlas from a set of image files.

## Preloading Textures

- **preload(completionHandler:)**: Loads an atlas object’s textures into memory, calling a completion handler after the task completes.
- **preloadTextureAtlases(_:withCompletionHandler:)**: Loads the textures of multiple atlas objects into memory, calling a completion handler after the task completes.
- **preloadTextureAtlasesNamed(_:withCompletionHandler:)**: Loads the textures of multiple atlases into memory, calling a completion handler after the task completes.

## Reading Source Image Filenames

- **textureNames**: The names of the texture images stored in the atlas.

## Instance Properties

- **customPlaygroundQuickLook**: A custom playground quick look for this instance.

## Textures

- **Maximizing Texture Performance**: Speed up image display and enable more images to be displayed at one time.
- **SKTexture**: An image, decoded on the GPU, that can be used to render various SpriteKit objects.
- **SKMutableTexture**: A texture whose contents can be dynamically updated.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- Copyable
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
